history.content:
Happy November! As midterm season comes to a close (or is still going), a group of student organizations have come together to help create a community during the virtual semester. So without further ado, welcome to EE/CS Community Week!

Raffle!

To encourage participation throughout this week, we will be having raffles equalling up to $500 worth of gift cards, tshirts, stickers, coasters, masks, and other swag. Each Facebook RSVP or Startup Fair RSVP will count as (1) ticket. Each event attendance counts as (2) tickets. 

*RSVPs will be taken off the FB/form lists. Attendance will be taken automatically by zoom (full duration attendance).

 

Facebook Page

Come like our Facebook page! We’ll be posting tips and tricks, resources, and other event details there :) Special raffles will be held for those who like/follow the page!

 

Workshops

Studying Skills and Adapting to the Virtual Environment

Date: Monday, November 16th

Time: 8-9pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Come join IEEE for a seminar on how to efficiently study and manage your stress in this virtual semester. Hear upperclassmen give some tips based on their experiences, and participate in some de-stressing activities!

 

Declaring CS: The 3.3 Hurdle

Date: Tuesday, November 17th

Time: 8-9pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Declaring CS is a long and stressful task, and after the first 61A midterm many people wonder if CS is really right for them. CSUA and UPE are hosting a CS intended panel, where students will talk about their own paths to CS and answer any questions you might have about the major.

 

Advising Sessions

Date: Tuesday, November 17th

Time: 7-9pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Hosted by CSUA, UPE, CSM, HKN, AWE, IEEE, come ask about anything Cal related. Questions about courses, internships, organizations, and more! Come ask whatever you want.

 

How to Get Involved with Teaching

Date: Wednesday, November 18th

Time: 5-6pm PST

Links: Zoom, Facebook

Description: Hosted by CSM, come learn more about how to get involved with teaching in the Berkeley Community. Hear from current student teachers about their experiences and any tips and advice that they have!

 

Creating a Personal Website

Date: Thursday, November 19th

Time: 5-6pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Come join HKN for a session to learn about personal websites and how to make one! Previous programming experience not required. 

 

Allyship and Involving Yourself in the Community

Date: Friday, November 20th

Time: 5-6pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Join AWE, SWE, and FemTech to learn how we can all be better allies in our communities. 

 

150 Years of Women Panel

Date: Saturday, November 21th

Time: 6-7pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Join IEEE for a virtual panel celebrating the 150th Anniversary of Women at Berkeley! Hear from a group of panelists about how they’ve promoted the inclusivity of women in their fields and what their experience as a successful professional woman has been. Our panelists for this event will be:

  • Tsu-Jae King Liu, Dean and Roy W. Carlson Professor of Engineering, College of Engineering

  • Camille Crittenden, Executive Director of CITRIS and the Banatao Institute, co-founder of the Women in Tech Initiative at UC

  • Dawn Song, Professor of Computer Science, Founder of Oasis Labs

  • Sarah Chasins, Assistant Professor of Computer Science

  • Esther Wojcicki, Vice Chair of Creative Commons, leading educator and journalist

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at ieee@berkeley.edu!

 

Social Events

Board Game Night

Date: Wednesday, November 18th

Time: 8-10pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: Hosted by CSUA, the weekly social is a chance for old and new friends to come together over zoom and play cool games like Among Us, Codename, and more. Join at csua.org/zoom for an exciting game of Among us, or just chat with CSUA members!

 

Minecraft Fridays

Date: Friday, November 20th

Time: 7-9pm PST

Links: Discord, Signup, Server Build Permissions

Description: Join IEEE for our weekly Minecraft Friday hosted on our Minecraft server! We will be playing Race for the Wool, which is a game where two teams compete on a custom map to capture wool blocks (representing flags). The first team to capture all of the flags wins!

(The Minecraft server is upgraded to the newest version, 1.16.3!)

IEEE Minecraft Server (IP): ieee-mc.ml

 

Movie and Discussion Night

Date: Saturday, November 21st

Time: 7-9:30pm PST

Links: Zoom Facebook

Description: To wrap up EE/CS Community week, join us for a fun movie night. Stay tuned to Facebook to vote on what movie you want to watch. Afterwards, AWE will host a discussion. 

 

Career Fair

UCB Global Startup Fair - Part 1

Date: Thursday, November 19th

Time: 6PM - 2 AM PST (End time subject to change)

Links: Website, RSVP

Description: Hosted by IEEE, CSUA, and HKN, the UCB Global Startup Fair is a unique recruitment event where the spotlight is on the startups. We bring together the most innovative new companies around the world and introduce them to students from one of the top engineering universities in the world.

 

UCB Global Startup Fair - Part 2

Date: Friday, November 20th

Time: 10AM - 2 PM PST

Links: Website, RSVP (same as above)
